text:
Sardinia invites visitors to its 5th edition of Bitas Published on : Monday, August 31, 2015
Green light to Bitas 5th edition, the active sports exhibition in Italy. The Bitas (“Borsa Internazionale del Turismo Attivo in Sardegna”) it’s the traditional exhibition that takes place in Sardinia every year to present the island in a new and unusual way: not only white sand beaches, crystalline water of the sea but also an inside Sardinia, with its unexplored routes and a lots of active sports to practise.
Sardinia is an open sky gym, able to attract more and more fans of nature and territories to discover the rhythm of his own passions.
This 5th edition will take place in Dorgali, in the north-eastern part of the island, in October (2nd, 3rd, 4th ) and on 30th August in Cala Gonone (Dorgali), at 21,30 with the documentary presentation from the famous Sardinian seafarer Gaetano Mura. The international adventure tourism in Sardinia is the leading in B2B marketing event that for two days will joint together the major international tour operators specialized and tourist operator and sport people from every where.
Tomorrow at Cine Teatro Arena (free entrance) will take place the “Uomini e storie di un’Isola” event, organized by the Dorgali Municipality and by the its department of “Hospitality and territorial marketing”. During the event the protagonist will be the sail and the sea in two different documentaries: “Le Favole iniziano a Cabras” (The fairy tales begin in Cabras) signed by the director Raffaello Fusaro and “Vivi come Sogni” (live like you dream) signed by the oceanic sailer Gaetano Mura. Both the authors will be present at the event and will tell, trough their films, their idea of Sardinia.
The Raffaello Fusaro film has been selected and showed with good appreciation at the Byron Bay in Australia festival and in other international prestigious appointment. In the film important Sardinian persons of arts and culture world talk about Sardinia: Antonio Marras (the fashion designer who has designed for the house Kenzo ), lo sculptor Pinuccio Sciola, the musicians Paolo Fresu e Gavino Murgia, the naturalistic filmmaker Domenico Ruiu just to say some of the names.
For sport areas Gaetano Mura explains that Sardinia could participate to the main international regattas and the film show an exceptional regatta. Watching the images with the sailor that plows through the waves of the ocean during the transoceanic Jacques Vabre, it’s easy to get excited.
La Bitas sarà organizzato dal comune di Dorgali e regione Sardegna.
L’evento sarà preceduto da diversi eventi nel mese di settembre.
EVENTS:
September 21th: CLIMBING – JOE KINDER E PATXI USOBIAGA
Shooting of Climbing along the cliffs of Cala Gonone performed by Joe Kinder and Patxi Usobiaga.
September 24th and 25th: APNEA CHALLENGE – DAVIDE CARRERA
The recordman diver Davide Carrera will attempt to set a new World record in constant weight apnea.
September 26th and 27th: T-NATURA – OROSEI – Cross Triathlon ITU World Championships 2015 opening race.
October 2nd and 4th: PARAGLIDING
Choreography over the skies of Cala Gonone – Take off from 14 up to 17. Landings to the Central and Palmasera beaches or to the Scrittiorè sports field.
– From 2 to 4 October 2015: MEDITERRANEAN ADVENTURE RACE – 2015 EDITION
A 3 days multisport event through the Supramonte area. The teams of 2 athletes, comes from all over the world to challenge each other on mountain bike, kayak, trekking, orienteering and caving.
October 3rd: CALA GONONE ENDURANCE CLIMBING – MANOLO (MAURIZIO ZANOLLA)
Entry restricted to members of F.A.S.I. Federazione Arrampicata Sportiva Italiana.
From 2 to 4 October 2015: ULTRA TRAK SUPRAMONTE SEASIDE
The Ultra Track Supramonte Seaside is an endurance adventure across the amazing and wild Supramonte. You can choose 3 different trail:
UTSS of 80km and 4000 mt of climb
TSS of 40km and 2000 mt of climb
BSS of 20 km and 1000 mt of climb.
THE ISLAND
Sardinia is the second largest island of Italy in middle of the Mediterranean sea. With over 1,800 km of coastline is the ideal destination for those who want to practice and learn about sports but thanks to its rugged territory, rich in green mountains inland, also lends itself to all other sports. Sardinia is also easy to reach thanks to its 3 international airports that provide daily direct flights to and from most European cities. Need no introduction its countless beaches and pristine white, wind-kissed and so sought after by tourists, from those who love and live the sea at 360 degrees.
